Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with part of elaborate tendril in added white with added red centres above white zigzag pattern between pairs of white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of horse (part of head and neck in outline, reins, one foreleg and black shoulder with red whirligig) galloping to right.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.412. Lemos describes this sherd as possibly belonging to the Naukratis Painter. The painter and the group are named after a chalice found at Naukratis and the slip on all vessels from this group is a light beige to almost creamy white. Rim patterns are very simple and there is no filling ornament. The depiction of figures, however, is very elaborate. Clothing is rendered highly decorated and naked skin is expertly portrayed.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 278, no. 757)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0732) (phase 2)
